DataElement.preferredName: Specimen National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project Central Laboratory Identifier Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the unique identifier for a specimen, a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes, assigned by the National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project (NSABP), a clinical trials cooperative group supported by the NCI, central laboratory, a laboratory delivering the data for a particular study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Specimen National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project Central Laboratory Identifier
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the unique identifier for a specimen, a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes, assigned by the National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project (NSABP), a clinical trials cooperative group supported by the NCI, central laboratory, a laboratory delivering the data for a particular study.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredName: National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project Central Laboratory Identifier
Property.preferredDefinition: The National Surgical adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project (NSABP) is a clinical trials cooperative group supported by the NCI. The group headquarters in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and has research sites at nearly 200 major medical centers, university hospitals, large oncology practice groups, and health maintenance organizations in the United States, Canada, Puerto Rico, and Australia. . In addition to funding from the NCI, which the NSABP has received since it began, the NSABP also receives support from other sources for ancillary studies, training, and educational programs.:A laboratory delivering the data for a particular study.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.longName: National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project
Concepts.definition: A clinical trials cooperative group supported by the NCI. The group headquarters in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and has research sites at nearly 200 major medical centers, university hospitals, large oncology practice groups, and health maintenance organizations in the United States, Canada, Puerto Rico, and Australia. In addition to funding from the NCI, which the NSABP has received since it began, the NSABP also receives support from other sources for ancillary studies, training, and educational programs.
A laboratory delivering the data for a particular study.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a question related to the identification number of the specimen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
